comments:
I20031216 (0800)

Recent changes in Main seem to make it impossible to launch a runtime workbench
when the plugin org.eclipse.platform is loaded as source in the workspace.  You
get the following exception on startup:

java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:438)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:269)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:741)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:582)

Tracing through getBootPath, it has computed the value of "installLocation" to be :

d:\1target\plugins\org.eclipse.platform\bin

Where "1target\plugins" is my workspace location.  It then appends "/plugins" to
this path, and when it searches for OSGi in this directory, it does not find it.
 It looks like it's missing the old logic of tracing up the parent chain in the
"searchFor" method to find the plugin (if it searched upwards, it would have
found 1target\plugins\org.eclipse.osgi).

If I delete the "org.eclipse.platform" project from my workspace, the runtime
workbench starts fine.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 48816 ***
